timeline.message:
bp: Flush instead of synced-flush inactive shards

https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/commit/1ca5dd13defa16a18e6374deb6f42d85f0d98309

This is the ES 7.6 version.
There is also the 8.0 version which we need to backport at a later
point.

https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/commit/725dda37ea570741595df25de2f86dc794cfec68

bp: Fix typo when assigning null_value in GeoPointFieldMapper

https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/commit/4b16d50cd4b7abf9789ea5e60517c37777ac805c

timeline.author: seut
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -353,8 +353,8 @@ should be crossed out as well.
 - [ ] c2deb287f13 Add a cluster setting to disallow loading fielddata on _id field (#49166)
 - [ ] 563b2736a9f Annotated text type should extend TextFieldType (#49555)
 - [ ] 7069045cd42 Add the simple strategy to cluster settings (#49414)
-- [ ] 725dda37ea5 Flush instead of synced-flush inactive shards (#49126)
-- [ ] b8ce07b4cc5 Pre-sort shards based on the max/min value of the primary sort field (#49092)
+- [d] 725dda37ea5 Flush instead of synced-flush inactive shards (#49126) -- CrateDB 5.0

replies.bodyText:
It's a bit confusing in this case - see the commit 364cce5
I applied the ES 7.6 variant but we'll still have to apply the mentioned commit 725dda37ea5 - which is the ES 8.0 variant.
replies.author: mfussenegger

timeline.bodyText: would this ever apply to crate? I mean the approach looks valid/interesting but the patch could not be used afaik..
timeline.author: seut
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -353,8 +353,8 @@ should be crossed out as well.
 - [ ] c2deb287f13 Add a cluster setting to disallow loading fielddata on _id field (#49166)
 - [ ] 563b2736a9f Annotated text type should extend TextFieldType (#49555)
 - [ ] 7069045cd42 Add the simple strategy to cluster settings (#49414)
-- [ ] 725dda37ea5 Flush instead of synced-flush inactive shards (#49126)
-- [ ] b8ce07b4cc5 Pre-sort shards based on the max/min value of the primary sort field (#49092)
+- [d] 725dda37ea5 Flush instead of synced-flush inactive shards (#49126) -- CrateDB 5.0
+- [d] b8ce07b4cc5 Pre-sort shards based on the max/min value of the primary sort field (#49092)

replies.bodyText: Yes it wouldn't apply as is to crate, I marked it as d so that we can later on have a closer look and see if we can utilize a similar approach
replies.author: mfussenegger
